intro: Coreocarpus parthenioides, commonly known as the silverleaf coreocarpus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal and limestone areas, characterized by its silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of the Rutaceae family. The plant has a distinctive aromatic scent, which is often described as similar to citrus.
